body: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/8QOPGYNO0ti1zh525JwTXGsOer4auRONU6L-*ZXpUr7iUoHnIkkVwRShWun*Tmvrsc8nRHuSAeSfcfo6UjBa51BLcq5CrK1R/WeatherHelp.jpg)Hello Mostapha, I completely agree with you (18 and 20). But as the help file of weather tool said the reference temperatures are 26 for cooling and 18 for heating. So I assume that the help file is rather not up to date or completely wrong. Coming from Autodesk I'm not surprised. thank you for your answer.
